revised_title: Recovery from Overstrain in Iron: Effects of Temperature, Mechanical Vibration, and Magnetic Agitation
tldr: This article investigates the recovery of iron from overstrain and the effects of temperature, mechanical vibration, and magnetic agitation on this process. The authors also discuss the phenomenon of hysteresis in the relation of extension to stress exhibited by overstrained iron. Their experiments were conducted at Cambridge University's Engineering Laboratory.
